description: {"blocks":[{"key":"qi7","text":"A real-time assay for the detection of Rubella virus RNA from clinical samples. This assay was modified from a published method with oligonucleotides updated, a different kit used, and cycling times adjusted accordingly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fo337","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

guidelines:
• If using a different brand or model of real-time thermocycler, check the concentration of ROX is adequate.
  • Method assumes the user is familiar with the thermocycler and software used to run the protocol.
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ll6f","text":"The definition used for a satisfactory positive result from a real-time fluorogenic PCR should include each of the following:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cm32k","text":"A\u00a0sigmoidal curve\u00a0\u2013 the trace travels horizontally, curves upward, continues in an exponential rise and followed by a curve towards a horizontal plateau phase","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":2,"length":15,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b00i0","text":"A\u00a0suitable level of fluorescence\u00a0intensity as measured in comparison to a positive control (y-axis)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":2,"length":30,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7hme3","text":"A defined threshold (CT) value which the fluorescent curve has clearly exceeded (Fig.1 arrow) and which sits early in the log-linear phase and is <40 cycles","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":22,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e312h","text":"A flat or non-sigmoidal curve or a curve that crosses the threshold with a CT\u00a0value >40 cycles is considered a negative result","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":76,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6i2j9","text":"NTCs should not produce a curve\u00a0","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dpu46","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"98faq","text":"a","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"dhn65","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ctlav","text":"Figure 1. Examples of satisfactory sigmoidal amplification curve shape when considering an assay\u2019s fluorescent signal output. The crossing point or threshold cycle (CT) is indicated (yellow arrow); it is the value at which fluorescence levels surpass a predefined (usually set during validation, or arbitrary) threshold level as shown in this normalized linear scale depiction. LP-log-linear phase of signal generated during the exponential part of the PCR amplification; TP-a slowing of the amplification and accompanying fluorescence signal marks the transition phase; PP-the plateau phase is reached when there is little or no increase in fluorescent signal despite continued cycling.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":8,"style":"bold"},{"offset":166,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"imageblock","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":null,"source":"https:\/\/s3.amazonaws.com\/pr-journal\/2sbhz4w.png","placeholder":"https:\/\/s3.amazonaws.com\/pr-journal\/2sbhz4w.png","original_name":"TaqMan curves.png","width":null,"height":null,"mime":null,"is_video":false}}],"guid":"9E698CC199CB46589D72F58254CEBDE2","id":668277,"previous_id":668276,"previous_guid":"AFBB8C9EBC0C4F82952CB72444B3E724","section":"Result Analysis"}
